key_points: The band New Radicals reunited after 22 years to perform "You Get What You Give" for the Biden-Harris virtual inaugural parade.
The band was essentially a duo: singer Gregg Alexander and percussionist Danielle Brisebois.
Their album 'Maybe Youâ€™ve Been Brainwashed Too' was released in 1998 and received critical acclaim.
"You Get What You Give" is celebrated for its optimistic message and has been significant to the Biden family.
The song was used by President Biden's late son Beau as a psych-up song during chemotherapy treatments.
New Radicals dissolved before releasing their second single as Alexander found the spotlight too stressful.
Members continued to influence pop music, with collaborations with other artists and contributions to hit songs.
Gregg Alexander performed at the inauguration, signaling a moment of optimism and resilience for many.
The song "You Get What You Give" is now considered an American standard, carrying the Presidential seal.
The reunion and performance emphasize a message of hope and the possibility of America 'pulling through' its challenges.
